name: Riverside Motel

reviews.title: Loved this motel
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are sort of 1970's looking, & it is a motel, but the view of Perkin's Cove, & the closeness to the footbridge to shopping were perfect. We had a great patio overlooking the cove, & spent many hours relaxing & enjoying our wonderful surroundings. This stay was exactly what we wanted in Ogonquit, views of the water, & next to Perkins Cove.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, relaxing, I would stay here again! Steps away from great shopping, sightseeing, and beautiful beaches! Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with my twin sister and favorite brother in law! The room was spotless, very friendly staff! We had a balcony end unit next to each other overlooking the cove!
reviews.title: Excellent location, clean and friendly!

reviews.text: My 18 year old granddaughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Riverside from June 16 through June 21. I cannot think of a negative thing to say about this motel, all is positive. The location is ideal, looking out over Perkins Cove and the ocean is serenity at it's best. Where else can you walk out of your room, across the footbridge to Perkins cove, where you will find, quaint shops, restaurants, boat rides, including sail boats and the entrance to Marginal Way. Cleanliness is excellent as other reviewers have stated. Sitting on the balcony in the morning I observed the staff, cleaning the chairs and actually wet mopping the balcony floor every day. I have never seen that done anywhere else I have stayed and I travel frequently. We met two sisters that were staying, they told us when they got there early they had to wait for their room to be cleaned, the staff took two hours to clean the room. That alone tells you how clean it is kept. The grounds and landscaping are also maintained in excellent condition. We were in a balcony room with two queen beds. This room was excellent, as also stated before, you walk from your car, right into the room, I loved the convenience of that. The motel was full when we were there and we found it to be extremely quiet. The continental breakfast was more than enough, orange juice, coffee, tea, milk, cereal, apples, bananas, muffins and doughnuts from Congdon's doughnuts, best dougnuts I have had in years. All the staff were more than friendly, always a hello, good morning, how are you etc. We had the pleasure of meeting and talking with Nancy and Geoff and were very impressed with how we would observe them working right along with the staff. The pride they have in their motel is more than evident. My granddaughter had never been to Maine before, I asked her if she would like to visit again, her response was, "only if we can stay here again" I think that says it all about what a great place The Riverside is.
reviews.title: Location,Cleanliness,Friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful location that overlooks Perkins Cove. Loved waking up to a scene of lobster boats and ocean activity. Hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable, with an attentive friendly staff. Downtown Ogunquit is a 20 minute walk from the Riverside and once there you have a hundred plus shops and eateries to chose from. Also, the Marginal Way is a fabulous two mile walk along the coastline that starts at the cove and ends very close to Ogunquit beach and downtown. Plenty to see and do. Have already reserved another weekend in the fall!
reviews.title: Fantasic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Riverside for two nights in celebration of our first anniversary. This place was not fancy at all, but the location and quality of the rooms more than makes up for that. We stayed in a balcony room overlooking Perkins Cove. The room was the perfect size for two people, and included free wifi (Get off the wifi and get outside, you're in Maine!!!) and a fridge. The grounds were perfectly manicured, and everything had a clean, well maintained feeling. The best part was being a very short distance from everything in Perkins Cove. The only downsides I could possibly come up with is that the balcony's aren't very private, you share a common balcony, separated by plastic chains. Also, the lobster boats in Perkins Cove leave very early in the morning, and the first morning we were there one of the fishermen decided to blast a George Thorogood song at about 5:30am. Kind of annoying, but the sunrise we got to witness because of our early wake up call was worth the annoyance. We will stay here again in the future!
reviews.title: Don't overlook this gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay when visiting Ogunquit. We never had to use our car. Everything is in walking distance, and if you don't feel like walking, there's a trolley that will take you anywhere in Ogunquit for $2! The view from the motel is beautiful. You're on Perkins Cove and can see the ocean across the cove. Just over the walking bridge is Perkin's Cove Center, where there are plenty of shops, restaurants and Marginal Way....all great places to visit. We will definitely stay there for our next visit.
reviews.title: Great Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a little getaway for our 3rd wedding anniversary on June 26th. He took me to the Riverside Motel right on Perkins Cove! OMW it was beautiful! The room was SO clean! My husband works and I used to work in the travel industry so we can be quite picky about where we stay..,.(We have a bad habit of going over our room with a fine tooth comb.) We look at EVERYTHING! And let me tell you, The housekeeping stuff is AMAZING!! Our room was spotless!! Even our deck and the deck chairs were spotless! Thank you for the WONDERFUL stay!! We plan on coming back!
reviews.title: Little slice of Heaven!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Geoff - We had another great stay at the Riverside from 6/6 to 6/9. Weather could have been better but we still enjoyed ourselves. Like many others,we cannot stress enough how clean the rooms are and how beautiful the grounds are. Your staff is wonderful and work very hard to keep everything immaculate. The continental breakfast is one of the best we have experienced. We look forward to visiting again next year.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: The Mulherns
reviews.title: Wonderful, cozy retreat!

reviews.text: We just stayed three nights at the Riverside and were delighted by the accommodations and the location. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. Th continental breakfast was especially good, the fresh doughnuts are to die for! The location is perfect. We loved walking over the footbridge to Perkins Cove. The grounds are perfectly manicured, it felt like we were in a postcard. We would definitely come back for another stay!
reviews.title: A nice, cozy place to stay
One night stay well with the price
reviews.text: On a trip through Northern New England, we planed on staying at Riverside for one night. Very easy check-in, all of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The view from our room/deck was one of the most picturesque we had ever seen. You're looking out over Perkins Cove loaded with Lobster boats mixed in with sail/power, with the Atlantic Ocean on the other side of the Cove. There is a footbridge leading to the shops and restaurants on the other side. We parked the car and did not need until we left. Great area to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: Even though the weather was rainy during my two night stay, we had a fabulous time. The room was fantastic, beds were very comfortable and the view was amazing. Who would have thought we would have needed heat at the end of May but we did, it took no time for the room to warm up. The gleaming hardwood floors was a nice change of pace from the usual drab carpeting of most hotels. The continental breakfast was a nice way to get us going in the morning. The proximity to Marginal way was a key to staying at this property, we did get soaked but it was a beautiful walk. The owner was very helpful and courteous. Check in and check out were a breeze and took no time at all. We will definitely be back in the future (hopefully during better weather).

reviews.title: Park and walk!!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and i stayed here one night...average older rooms but was clean and close to perkins cove and the marginal way....park and walk! Was nice not to have to drive everywhere. Had a nice little continental breakfast before we headed out the next morning!

reviews.title: Best motel in Ogunquit!
reviews.text: We arrived a little early for check in, but since our rooms were ready, we were graciously welcomed to check in. When I opened the door to our balcony room, I was blinded by they beautiful gleaming hard wood floors. The room was immaculate. The first thing I always check is the bathroom. You can tell a great hotel versus a bad hotel with one look, and this was a great hotel. The tile shined, the tub and sink spotless without a hint of mildew. Not an easy task when you are located at the ocean. I could tell this was going to be a great stay by how meticulous everything was inside and out. The view from the balcony was breath taking. The cove right in front of us and the ocean waves breaking across the way. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and at night you could hear a pin drop and we had people on either side of us. The continental breakfast was a big plus for us since I do not function without that first cup of coffee. It is located in where the office is and is a bright, warm and inviting atmosphere. There are tables, sofas, and a fireplace. Plenty of books and games for a rainy day or just to relax. I truly could go on and on about all the great things Riverside has to offer, but it would be a novel when I was done. We raved so much about it, other family members are looking forward to checking it out. All in all, it was one of my favorite stays in Maine, and I have been going for 40 years!

reviews.title: An Excellent Stay in Ogunquit
reviews.text: The Riverside is located on beautiful Perkins Cove in Ogunquit. The motel has incredibly well landscaped grounds and great views of the cove and the Atlantic beyond. The rooms are spacious and immaculately kept. There is a wonderful continental breakfast provided that included tasty doughnuts and muffins from Congdon's when we were there. There is plenty of parking and it is very easy to get to downtown Ogunquit by car or on foot. This is a perfect hotel to choose if you enjoy walking the breathtaking Marginal Way as it is directly across the street. The staff is very friendly and helpful. You will really enjoy your stay here. We will definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside is the best location location in Ogunquit for the traveler who wants to arrive, park the car, and forget about decisions for the length of their stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view of Perkins Cove and the Atlantic on the other side is wonderful. The up and down of the drawbridge and the coming and going of work boats and pleasure boats a nice diversion, including the occasional sigthting of former President Bush coming for lunch at Barnacle Billy's.
reviews.title: Way past 5 stars...

reviews.text: An easy walk to Marginal Way for sightseeing, or many restaurant choices, and a more than adequate continental breakfast is provided by the motel.
reviews.title: Not at all what I had expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are old style motel, but exceptionally clean, roomy, and have nice balconies with comfortable chairs.
reviews.title: Another Great Visit
